title: A method to increase honors per game
body:
I have an idea that could increase the use of the honor system,  increasing positive feedback among players.

The current system:

* You can only honor a player at the end of the game.
* You skip it most of the time because you want to check stats, or your tilted, etc... 

The new system:

* Add a button similar to the microphone button, or Zoes champion clone:

      * where players can select a champion/teammate to honor throughout the game,
      * can switch what champion to honor throughout the game,
      * can confirm or skip at the end of the game, with a bigger confirm button.

replies.body: People who dont honor wont suddenly do it via an obscure button ingame.
I think the idea is that sometimes somebody does something ingame where you think to yourself "wow, gotta honor that guy later" and then you forget who it actually was.
Then it mustve never been that impactful of a play if you forgot who it was within 15 mins.

The true problem here is that we tend to skip honouring the player because of the ill taste of defeat (in some cases) that we have towards the end of the game. The idea behind having a button on the bottom of the screen, for eg, will allow us to recognize the player's gameplay at that moment rather than have it linger towards the end of the game - when many reasons might deter us from taking the time to acknowledge a player.
Bring back honouring enemies again. Dunno why that was taken out

> Zoes champion clone

You mean neeko? Not zoe right?

The entire honor system is completely pointless. Does anyone actually believe it improves player behavior? It's just another one of Riot's harebrained schemes to "gamify" good behavior. All of it has failed miserably which is why you don't hear about them trying to address "toxicity" anymore. If Riot had even the remotest inkling of a clue about human behavior, you would have seen a drop in "toxic" behavior some time in the past 10 years.
Seems like an unnecessary distraction. And I personally wouldn't need it. If someone in my team deserves honoring, I'll honor them, I never suddenly forget about them when the game ends.
